txt.en: 'I have seen lighted windows in the evil city of Carn DÃ»m.'
'The Dark Lord Sauron stirs again in Mordor.'
'The dread land of Angmar stirs.'
Instance: Galadriel's Dream
'I have seen his servants abroad, and know their number.'
'I am Galadriel, the Lady of the Golden Wood. Do not be afraid, young one.'
'Shadows once stretched forth from Angmar to threaten Middle-earth.'
'They are seeking an heirloom of great power that he lost and desperately wants to recover.'
'Your kind is known to me, but I have beheld hobbits such as you only from afar.'
'I fear they will again.'
'They must not find it.'
You are held in the grip of a peculiar dream.
You are held in the grip of a dream.
'I am Galadriel, the Lady of the Golden Wood. Do not be afraid, my friend.'
'Your people are short-lived, but the fate of Middle-earth is yours to command.'
'You are near to wakefulness, [placeholder]. The last tendrils of sleep will soon release you.'
'You ask why I wanted to show you this? It is for one reason.'
'I saw you in my Mirror. Not once or twice, but often.'
'Whether you desire it or not, your fate is tied to that of Middle-earth.'
'Do not forget my words when you awaken.'
'You know me, [placeholder], and I know you. You are one of my kin.'
'The Free Peoples of Middle-earth will have need of you. You must not fail them.'
'One day we will take the ships into the West. But it is not yet time.'
You are asleep, and experiencing a most peculiar dream...
'All of Middle-earth is endangered by the return of Sauron.'
'We need strength, wisdom, and courage if we are to oppose him.'
'[placeholder]...'
You are asleep and dreaming.
'Men, Elves, dwarves, hobbits... all free folk must stand together.'
'Listen to my words...'
'I will not long disturb your sleep. I can visit you in dreams for only a short time.'
'I have looked into my Mirror and seen much that worries me. Let me show you.'
You are having a most peculiar dream.
'I am Galadriel, the Lady of the Golden Wood. Do not be afraid, friend dwarf.'
'The friendship between our peoples has been strained, but I hope it has not been lost.'
'My Mirror shows me much else I do not understand.'
'Some of this may come to pass, or none of it. That is the nature of my Mirror's power.'
